result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerrell M Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharges, costs, disbursements and supervision fees.  If revoked, to be taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to then be paid on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.  Parenting classes/counseling.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with MATC-Oak Creek campus.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerrell M Owens

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Amended Pretrial Release Conditions Order, signed and filed.
TOT to Justice Point; no alcohol or drugs; urine screens; no firearms or weapons.

Defendant Jerrell M Owens in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail hearing proceeds.  Defendant did not pay the administrative fee to have sample analyzed; defendant tested positive for THC on two occasions.  Arguments heard as to bail; State takes no position.  Court set bail at $500.00 cash.  Case remains calendared for plea and sentencing on 8/07/14 at 8:30 a.m.
Violation Report (copy from Justice Point), received and filed.

Defendant Jerrell M Owens in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Justice Point violation addressed.  Defense counsel indicates that his client wants to verify the test.  Court ordered defendant to pay the $25.00 testing fee; case continued for bail hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.

Defendant Jerrell M Owens in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested a plea date.   Court ordered case continued before Branch 20; all conditions of bail remain.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerrell M Owens in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Paul Hauer for Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jerrell M Owens in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Jerrell M Owens in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 5844 N 84th St, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
